
# Contributing to CPI Bangladesh Projects

Thank you for your interest in contributing to the CPI Bangladesh digital ecosystem! Your contributions are essential for improving the tools and systems that support our humanitarian mission.

To ensure a smooth and effective collaboration, please follow these guidelines.

## Table of Contents
1. [Code of Conduct](#code-of-conduct)
2. [Getting Started](#getting-started)
3. [How to Contribute](#how-to-contribute)
    - [Reporting Bugs or Issues](#reporting-bugs-or-issues)
    - [Suggesting Enhancements](#suggesting-enhancements)
    - [Submitting Changes (Pull Requests)](#submitting-changes-pull-requests)
4. [Style Guides](#style-guides)
    - [Git Commit Messages](#git-commit-messages)
    - [Data Files (CSV/Excel)](#data-files-csv-excel)
5. [Questions?](#questions)

## Code of Conduct
All contributors are expected to uphold our **Code of Conduct**. Please read it before participating. *(You will need to create a `CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md` file, but this link is a good placeholder)*. We are committed to providing a welcoming and harassment-free environment for everyone.

## Getting Started
- Ensure you have been added to the appropriate [GitHub Team](https://github.com/orgs/CPI-BGD/teams ) with the correct permissions.
- For most repositories, you will need to clone the repository to your local machine to make changes.
  ```bash
  git clone https://github.com/CPI-BGD/repository-name.git
